Articles.Content: So, as most people, when I started KSP, I was a complete Newbie. (I still am, haven't even landed on the Mun yet, but that's not the point.) Now, thanks to the very well put together in game tutorials, I can make a spaceworthy craft, and get to orbit, thanks to Wernher Von Kerman and Gene Kerman. I have played many games in the past, and I usually had to read up on their wikis and watch videos, even if they had in game tutorials, but it was not the case with KSP. Good job, Squad, I am very happy with my purchase! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It is still worth looking at videos, especially by Scott Manley. You will find out just a bit more how far down the rabbit hole goes! ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

I watch Scott Manley, he is very good at KSP! I just watched a video today about landing an aircraft on a mountain, in KSP! I will watch more and more, for now, being a complete newbie, some of the videos boggle the mind.. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Yay. Somebody who doesn't rant about the tutorials!

Oh yeah, welcome to the forums! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
